Anyone wearing Allied Tags while participating in a campaign battle will be judged on their overall performance.<Prompt>
Soldiers will be evaluated not only on their fighting skills, but also on how much they contribute to the efforts of their allies through means such as healing and enhancing.<Prompt>
However, beware that if you leave the area before being assessed, you will be deemed a deserter and will forfeit all rewards earned that day.<Prompt>
Also, while there are no immediate penalties for being knocked out, falling in battle will significantly lower the score given to you.<Prompt>
When you are ready to receive compensation for your work on the field, return to me and I shall assess your performance and provide you with your payment.<Prompt>
Allied Tags are a special type of identification given to all participants of Allied Campaign battles.<Prompt>
There are benefits, as well as drawbacks, to wearing the tags. One of the benefits is that in the case you are knocked out on the battlefield, you will not lose any experience points.<Prompt>
However, some of the drawbacks include the inability to improve skills and earn experience points for individual kills, as well as the right to loot fallen enemies.<Prompt>
Temporary items can be purchased in exchange for Allied Notes.<Prompt>
There are several different varieties of items, but they all have one thing in common--they can only be used on the battlefield they were issued.<Prompt>

(DEBUG) Flag raised, kupo!<Prompt>
Welcome, Master! This is your home, the  Mog House,  kupo!<Prompt>
I'm a moogle! We moogles like taking care of houses and items! Nice to meet you, kupo!<Prompt>
I'll tell you all about your Mog House, kupo!<Prompt>
First, the basics, kupo! Open your main menu, Master. The button at the very bottom changes to  Mog House  when you're in your Mog House, kupo!<Prompt>
Press it and the  Mog House  menu will appear! Everything you can do in your Mog House is there, kupo!<Prompt>
There are lots of things you can do in your Mog House, kupo! It can be too much for some masters, kupo...<Prompt>
So I'll teach you about each one of them! Ask me what you want to know about, kupo!<Prompt>
Choose the Mog House command you want to know about, kupo!<Prompt>
What do you want to know about. <Selection Dialog>The Mog Safe. Storage. The Delivery Box. Changing jobs. Gardening. Changing the layout. Mog House invitations. I got it, thanks, kupo!<Prompt>
The Mog Safe is where I keep items that you can't carry! It's an especially secure and solid safe, kupo!<Prompt>
You can only put so many items in it, kupo... But I'll guard them even if it means my life, kupo!<Prompt>
The Delivery Box is where you can send letters to friends and receive items from various places, kupo!<Prompt>
You should take the items from your Delivery Box and put them in your inventory when they arrive, kupo!<Prompt>
If your Delivery Box is full, no more deliveries can be made, and you can't send any mail either, kupo!<Prompt>
You can send items and gil to your friends with the  Send  command, kupo!<Prompt>
(Sometimes, if a special force takes hold, you can even deliver items with the "Exclusive" attribute, kupo...!)<Prompt>
Changing people's jobs is a secret ability only we moogles can use, kupo!<Prompt>
I take off all your equipment and take you to a mysterious place, kupo!<Prompt>
And...the rest is a secret, kupo!<Prompt>
All moogles like taking care of plants, kupo!<Prompt>
As long as you have a flowerpot and seeds, I'll make it my personal responsibility to look after the plants you raise, kupo!<Prompt>
This Mog House is your very own room, kupo! But it's still a little bare, kupo...<Prompt>
It needs some furniture and maybe some paintings to make it more cozy, kupo!<Prompt>
If you find any during your travels, I'll help you lay them out, kupo! I can't wait, kupo!<Prompt>
Storage space becomes available when you place furniture in your Mog House using the  Layout  command, kupo!<Prompt>
It's almost exactly the same as using your Mog Safe, kupo! Leave your items here for me to look after, kupo!<Prompt>
You can invite party and alliance members into your Mog House, kupo!<Prompt>
You can show off your expensive furniture, have tea parties, plan your next great adventure--the possibilities are endless, kupo!<Prompt>
Are you sure, kupo. You know everything about your Mog House, kupo.<Prompt>
Are you sure. <Selection Dialog>I'm sure! Maybe I'm not so sure...<Prompt>
And finally, a little bit of advice!<Prompt>
If you ever run into any problems, just ask your fellow adventurers for help!<Prompt>
If you type  /ae Hello! , then your message will be heard by many people.<Prompt>
If you type  /ae  followed by your issue or question, other adventurers will help you!<Prompt>
Remember that you can only do this while in town, kupo!<Prompt>
Okay, kupo! Good luck on your adventuring, kupo!<Prompt>
Do you want me to teach you about your Mog House again, kupo.<Prompt>

Why, you spineless milksop! Get yourself lost, and all you can do is wail and whimper 'til some passerby takes pity on you. Have you no shame!.<Prompt>
But F-Father...<Prompt>
Enough of your sniveling! You are Elvaan! You are to conduct yourself with honor and dignity at all times!<Prompt>
B-but...but F-Father...!<Prompt>
I'll forge you into shape yet! You can stand there alone until you figure out what it means to act like a man!<Prompt>
No, Father! Why must you be so cruel. Don't leave me!<Prompt>
My apologies for any trouble imposed upon you by my lily-livered brat of a son.<Prompt>
Please accept this in return for your efforts.<Prompt>
What. But Father... That's my f-favorite <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#  !<Prompt>
Silence! Until you dry those shameful tears, you are no son of mine!<Prompt>
M-my <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#  ...<sniff>... Without it, I c-cannot...<sob>...<Prompt>
C-could it be. You've come to return this to me.<Prompt>

Oh, thank you ever so much! This is the <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#   that I shall wield to protect my family and Kingdom when I become a great, strong knight!<Prompt>
And yet...I cannot accept it from you.<Prompt>
Father has forbidden me from bearing arms save for as part of my weapons training. I can receive this sword only when he deems me...<sniff>...worthy of it once more.<Prompt>

<Sniff>... You are too kind, <Prompt>.[milord/milady]. But I can accept that <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#   when Father himself returns it to me, and not before.<Prompt>
The <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#   was returned to you.<Prompt>
Exoroche! <Prompt>
Father...<Prompt>
She's a beauty, is she not. My hard-won catch of the day!<Prompt>
And I believe this is yours as well.<Prompt>
C-could it be!. My <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#  !<Prompt>
Thank you, Father!<Prompt>
Bah! Were it my decision, you'd not have seen it again until you were a man grown. You have the generosity of this stranger here to thank.<Prompt>
Oh, you truly are too kind! <Prompt>.[Milord/Milady], ah...<Prompt>
Thank you, <Prompt>.[Milord/Milady] <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 8)>!<Prompt>
Well, now that you have a blade again, I suppose I must teach you to swing it without lopping off your own extremities.<Prompt>
Truly. On my honor, Father, I shan't let you down!<Prompt>
Oho! There's a spirited reply. I just might make a knight of you yet!<Prompt>
Hail, Exoroche! What a charming little <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#   you have there. A fitting toy for a child such as yourself, methinks.<Prompt>
Me, I've already received a xiphos from my father. A true knight's weapon, you see.<Prompt>
Perhaps we can spar sometime. Should you ever feel the need for a proper bruising, that is! Hahaha!<Prompt>
<Sniff>... F-Father...<Prompt>
Hear me well, Exoroche.<Prompt>
Let others say as they will.<Prompt>
In the end, 'tis not the mightiest sword, nor even the savviest fencer who shall win the day. It is the one with honor and justice on his side.<Prompt>
Remember this always, discipline yourself in mind and body, and you will grow strong.<Prompt>
Yes, Father! One day, I shall be the strongest, bravest knight in the Kingdom! I will make you proud!<Prompt>
I've not felt such a close bond with my son in quite some time. I am in your debt, <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 8)>.<Prompt>
As it seems the lad will have need of his <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#   after all, pray accept this instead as a token of my gratitude.<Prompt>
The boy may be tender in years, but his heart is true. I shall endeavor to see him raised to be as strong and honorable as yourself.<Prompt>
I may have neither the strongest arm nor the sharpest blade, but I shall always fight for honor and justice!<Prompt>

<Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)>Hey, you're in the way. We fortifyin' this here wall to withstand the beastmen's siege turrets. So how's about just gettin' outta here before you get hurt.<Prompt>
Unless you're willin' to wipe that helpless look off your face and lend us a hand. That'd be a different story.<Prompt>
Assist with the fortifications. <Selection Dialog>Show them how it's done! Refuse to help. Ask for an explanation.<Prompt>
Alright! That's the spirit! Let's get a move on, then.<Prompt>
Hmph, I figured as much by lookin' at you. Beat it, then. This is no place for tourists.<Prompt>

Like I said, in preparation for an enemy assault, we're workin' to fortify these defensive barriers. If you're willin', I'd like to place you in charge of managin' these here craftsmen as they go about it.<Prompt>

To be more precise, once you get to each craftsman's position, you have to tell 'em exactly what I'm about to tell you. Namely, what type of crystal they need to be usin'. That's all there is to it.<Prompt>
The young Elvaan wearin' the red hat is a blacksmith. Make sure he's using fire crystals.<Prompt>
The adorable little Tarutaru with the blonde braids is laying plaster. Gonna have to get her on some ice crystals.<Prompt>
The Hume lady is a stonemason, and a darn good one. She's gonna be needin' wind crystals.<Prompt>
That old coot of an Elvaan with the huge axe strapped across his back is a carpenter. Famous 'round these parts. Make sure you get him workin' with earth crystals.<Prompt>
May not look it, but the Mithra with the black kerchief wrapped 'round her noggin is an architect. She's gonna need her lightning crystals.<Prompt>
That sprat of a Tarutaru wearin' the blue getup's a handy lil' plumber. Surin' he'll be wantin' his water crystals, no doubt.<Prompt>
The good-looking fella in all white does scaffoldin'. Young Hume lad. See to it he's usin' light crystals.<Prompt>
The lady Elvaan's a painter. Handles a brush like nobody I never seen. Need dark crystals in that line of work. And that's it.<Prompt>
Ahhh, one more thing. If you're too late issuin' your orders, they're liable to up and leave their posts. So be right, and be quick.<Prompt>
Choose a crystal! <Selection Dialog>Fire crystal. Ice crystal. Wind crystal. Earth crystal. Lightning crystal. Water crystal. Light crystal. Dark crystal. Plumb give up.<Prompt>
Hey now, you're runnin' this here operation! You can't just quit! There's no quitting in war!<Prompt>
Wow... You sure botched that job. All them wrong orders threw the craftsmen off kilter. They're demandin' a new foreman.<Prompt>
Well, the good news is you're gettin' your orders right. The bad news is that you're takin' your sweet time doing it. We'll never be ready for the Beastmen at this rate.<Prompt>
Come on, now! You even want to win this war!. The craftsmen are startin' to strike thanks to your incompetence!<Prompt>

At first glance, atmacite appears to be the perfect artificial enhancement. However, it does suffer from a single limitation: its power is unleashed only when engaged in a Voidwatch operation.<Prompt>
Research to identify the exact reason for this continues, but most scientists find the spectral alignment theory compelling.<Prompt>
That is, being formed of Voidwalker souls, atmacite will surge to life only when its bearer is existentially aligned to its dimension of origin.<Prompt>
From this it can be inferred that Voidwalkers are stripped of considerable strength when they cross over into Vana'diel.<Prompt>
But I suspect this is of little interest to a layman like you. Allow me to return to the subject at hand.<Prompt>
The infusion of atmacite requires cruor, a potent energy source that takes the form of shiny red granules.<Prompt>
Cruor is obtainable by various means, felling a Voidwalker being the most common of all. As you can never have too much cruor, I urge you to be diligent in its procurement.<Prompt>
We've recently perfected a method for improving atmacite potency. The process is called enrichment, and involves fusing cruor on to atmacite to amplify its power.<Prompt>

Atmacite can be enriched in stages up to a maximum of level <Numeric (Parameter 0)>. The quantity of cruor required varies with the variety of atmacite as well as its current enrichment level.<Prompt>

Under normal conditions, atmacite enrichment is an intensive process that demands trained hands. For reasons yet to be determined, however, both infusion and enrichment can be safely performed by laymen, provided they're at a planar rift.<Prompt>
Keep this in mind should the need arise to reconfigure your atmacite with haste.<Prompt>

Voidwalker  is the name given to creatures that roam the realm between worlds.<Prompt>
Little is known about them at this time, except that they're driven by an insatiable lust for destruction.<Prompt>
While reports of Voidwalker encounters vary greatly in content, one thing is certain: the creatures are gaining in strength, a mounting threat that cannot be left unchecked.<Prompt>
In our effort to neutralize the Voidwalker menace, the Voidwatch is petitioning adventurers to lend their aid.<Prompt>
As the nature of Voidwalker battles renders full-scale military operations unfeasible, we have chosen to stake our success on the mobility and versatility of adventurers.<Prompt>
In our effort to neutralize the Voidwalker menace, the Voidwatch is petitioning soldiers of the Allied Forces to lend their aid.<Prompt>
To be sure, there're those who question the wisdom of thinning our ranks in the face of the Shadow Lord's armies. But I assure you, friend, the Voidwalker threat is no less real.<Prompt>
Our scouts regularly bring back intel on locations of suspected Voidwalker presence.<Prompt>
Armed with this information, we dispatch strike teams to preemptively neutralize the threat.<Prompt>
Ordinarily, Voidwalkers cannot be seen, let alone fought. Only by using the voidstone's power can we force them to feel the sting of our steel.<Prompt>
These magicked stones are distributed in regular shipments from our Jeuno-based research team. They're the bare minimum we need to have a fighting chance against the enemy.<Prompt>
Voidstones work by realigning your existential spectrum to match that of Voidwalkers, thus rendering the creatures visible to you.<Prompt>
The stones are highly prized, such is the difficulty of their creation. As such, supplies are limited to <Numeric (Parameter 0)> stones per person at any given time.<Prompt>
That's provided we have any in stock at all. Much time is required in imbuing them with requisite powers.<Prompt>
The Voidwatch is an organization that exists for the sole purpose of protecting the world from extradimensional invaders we call  Voidwalkers. <Prompt>
Recognizing the graveness of this threat, the nations of the Middle Lands joined together in common cause and formed the Voidwatch.<Prompt>
Helming the organization is the Grand Duchy of Jeuno, with the remaining three nations contributing resources for its operation.<Prompt>
Possession of <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>6   is a requirement for participating in Voidwatch Ops.<Prompt>
It can be earned only through loyal service to your nation, and thus serves as a testimonial for your prowess.<Prompt>
You would do well to obtain one if you haven't already done so.<Prompt>
Affiliation with the Allied Forces of Altana is a requirement for participating in Voidwatch Ops.<Prompt>
In other words, you must belong to the armed forces of one of the three nations.<Prompt>
The enlistment procedure varies depending on nation. Those wishing to obtain a recommendation letter should pay visit to one of the military encampments surrounding Jeuno.<Prompt>
When you battle a Voidwalker, you must do so as a  Voidwatcher --a defender of the dimension who has harnessed the powers of the voidstone and stratum abyssite.<Prompt>
Bereft of these two objects, Voidwalkers cannot be seen, let alone fought.<Prompt>
However, there are a few points all budding Voidwatchers should bear in mind.<Prompt>
Most crucial of all, the extradimensional nature of being a Voidwatcher renders you isolated and unable to receive help from the outside world.<Prompt>
Scientists attribute this to the dimensional misalignment that occurs. As people are ordinarily unable to see Voidwalkers, so too are they unable to see you.<Prompt>
But you needn't concern yourself with the hows and whys of such matters. It would behoove you far more to become familiar with the workings of the  existential spectrum. <Prompt>
You see, each dimension is composed of an existential spectrum to which all things within are aligned. In turn, the spectrum is formed of five lights: blue, red, yellow, green, and white.<Prompt>
The alignment of these lights between Voidwalker and Voidwatcher plays an important role in our efforts.<Prompt>
To elaborate, the act of rendering a Voidwalker visible is essentially an act of aligning ourselves to its existential spectrum.<Prompt>

Now, while Voidwatchers are able to, for all practical purposes, interact with these creatures, they in fact fall short of full alignment. Symptoms of this imperfect state can be observed in the limited quantity and quality of spoils normally yielded by Voidwalkers.<Prompt>
Compensating measures, however, have been developed to allow combatants to more closely attune themselves with their extradimensional foe.<Prompt>
One such method involves the use of alignment-enhancing artifacts known as  ascent items,  while another entails performing certain actions against the enemy.<Prompt>
Both methods aim to manipulate the alignment value of individual lights to various ends.<Prompt>
All five lights influence the contents of the treasure chest which appears at the successful end of battle.<Prompt>
Our researchers have succeeded in determining what manner of benefits are associated with each light.<Prompt>
For instance, improving blue spectral alignment is known to produce greater quantities of spoils.<Prompt>
In contrast, manipulating red spectral alignment reportedly enhances the quality of individual items--potions becoming hi-potions, and so forth.<Prompt>
Yellow and green, on the other hand, influence experience gain and cruor yield respectively.<Prompt>
If you wish to know more about the curious red substance we call cruor, you need but ask.<Prompt>
Lastly, we have white spectral alignment, which is unique even in this company. It has been determined to affect the appearance of transdimensional objects such as atmacite and periapt.<Prompt>
Research regarding these artifacts is still ongoing.<Prompt>
Lastly, be reassured that there're no known negative effects of manipulating spectral alignment. We unreservedly encourage all Voidwatch operatives to endeavor towards maximum alignment.<Prompt>
Ascent items are unique objects that can be used to manipulate the spectral alignment of corresponding lights in the existential spectrum.<Prompt>

<Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Possible Special Item>   and <Possible Special Item>   are representative of such items. They're the pride and joy of our Jeuno-based research team, who'd have folk believe they're the greatest inventions since airships.<Prompt>
(Just between you and me, though, it is Far Eastern scientists that pioneered the technology they're based upon.)<Prompt>
They're not the only means by which we manipulate spectral alignment, mind you. Similar results can be achieved by performing specific actions against the enemy.<Prompt>
Truth be told, much is still shrouded in mystery. What actions will produce the desired effect is something you will have to discover for yourself through trial and error.<Prompt>
Defeating a Voidwalker will cause a mysterious pyxis to emerge at the selfsame planar rift whence the creature was felled.<Prompt>
Such riftworn pyxides exhibit a most peculiar characteristic: the content they bear reportedly changes depending on who glimpses within.<Prompt>

Our scientists conjecture that this is due to some trick of spectral alignment. As with numerous other mysteries surrounding Voidwalkers, however, I highly doubt they have even an inkling of understanding. But I digress...<Prompt>
Only one combatant need possess a voidstone for all party or alliance members to do battle with a Voidwalker. Of the other squad members only stratum abyssite is required.<Prompt>
As always seems to be the case, however, there is a catch. Pyxides have been observed to yield less spoils for combatants without a voidstone of their own.<Prompt>
It scarce needs be said, but it would be to your benefit to have both the aforementioned items readied before taking on a Voidwalker.<Prompt>

Lastly, a warning: pyxides will eventually vanish if left untouched overlong. Our scientists have put forth the theory of normalizing spatial dissonance, but you needn't concern yourself with their mumbo-jumbo.<Prompt>
Just see to it that your hard-earned spoils are claimed in good time, and things will be rosy for all involved.<Prompt>
The <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>3   is a magicked object produced by the Voidwatch's Jeuno-based research wing.<Prompt>
Its innocuous appearance belies the immense power it holds...the power to render Voidwalkers visible to its bearer.<Prompt>
The stone achieves this feat by realigning our existential spectrum to that of the creature.<Prompt>
I shall explain the process in layman's terms for your benefit. No need to thank me--I merely perform my duty.<Prompt>
I want you to visualize two canvases, each the same distance from the other. Yes, as two separate objects are normally wont to be.<Prompt>
Imagine you and I standing on one of the canvases--what else does one do with a canvas but stand on it, yes.<Prompt>
Now, imagine Voidwalkers standing on the other canvas, doing whatever it is Voidwalkers do. Destroying things and behaving with utter impropriety, no doubt.<Prompt>

Being on two different canvases, it follows that we cannot touch the Voidwalkers, let alone see them. Actually, that doesn't explain why we can't see the Voidwalkers...unless it's a magical canvas they're on that makes all things upon it invisible! Yes, that'll serve!<Prompt>

And this brings us full circle back to the voidstone. I want you to think of it as a magical paintbrush that we use to...grapple ourselves over to the Voidwalkers' canvas. Thence the fighting begins.<Prompt>
I trust you now have a rudimentary understanding of the process. That's all you need, really. Leave the fractal geometry to the fractal geometrists, I always say.<Prompt>
As long as you remember the canvas and the paintbrush--that's the voidstone--you cannot go astray. Now, to apprise you of more practical matters...<Prompt>

At any rate, should you manage to obtain any <Set colour #5>voiddust<Set colour #1> in your travels, you need only return here and trade it to me. Simple enough, wouldn't you say.<Prompt>
Furthermore, this particular variety of abyssite is known to absorb the energy released by felled Voidwalkers. Not any of the creatures, mind you, but only those drawn to planar rifts.<Prompt>
Based on the evolutionary state of your stratum abyssite, the Voidwatch will direct you to a suitable operation area.<Prompt>
If you wish to have your stone analyzed, simply present it to an atma refiner.<Prompt>
Planar rifts--weak points in the fabric of space--have manifested across the land. The Voidwalker hordes roam beyond, unchecked and ever seeking to enter and plunge Vana'diel into chaos.<Prompt>
By invoking the power of stratum abyssite, it is possible to battle the fell creatures as a  Voidwatcher --a defender of our dimension.<Prompt>
Those also possessed of a voidstone will find their Voidwatcher experience greatly enhanced.<Prompt>
Alone, however, stratum abyssite serves no purpose; only when used in conjunction with a voidstone can its powers be unleashed.<Prompt>
Hence, at least one member of your squad--be it party or alliance--must possess a voidstone in order to arrange a confrontation with a Voidwalker.<Prompt>
Keep this fact in mind at all times.<Prompt>
It is not known when the planar rifts first manifested. Some say they've always been there, while others claim recent events have triggered their appearance.<Prompt>
If only we could return to the past, perhaps we could shed some light upon this mystery...<Prompt>
Obtainable by defeating Voidwalkers, cruor is an energy source that takes the form of shiny red granules.<Prompt>
While appearing to be some manner of mineral, detailed analysis has revealed that cruor is in fact organic.<Prompt>
As far as our researchers can tell, however, it's inanimate like most well-behaved plants. There's no fear of cruor suddenly springing to life in your palms.<Prompt>

Being supremely pleasing to the eyes, cruor might have adorned the display cases of many a jewelry shop during peacetime. Unfortunately, the age demands that its unique properties be put to more practical uses.<Prompt>
Namely, the infusion and enrichment of atmacite. If you wish to learn about these two processes, you need but ask an atmacite refiner, our experts on such matters.<Prompt>

As cruor is a vital aspect of our operations, the Voidwatch is always looking to procure more. Should you have any excess cruor, we would be glad to take it off your hands and offer you useful items in exchange.<Prompt>

Welcome to the MHMU's porter service, kupo! Which of your burdensome belongings shall I take off your hands today.<Prompt>
Do something, kupo. <Selection Dialog>Porter service. Buy a storage slip. No, thank you.<Prompt>
Is your gobbiebag splitting at the seams. Mog Safe spilling over. Why, an accomplished adventurer like yourself surely has more stuff than you know what to do with.<Prompt>
That's where I come in, kupo. I'll gladly hold onto your prized possessions, freeing you space to gather up even grander goodies.<Prompt>
To make use of my services, first you'll need to buy one of these storage slips for the low, low fee of <Numeric (Parameter 19)> gil.<Prompt>
Storage slips come in numerous varieties, kupo, each corresponding to a different type of item.<Prompt>
You'll want to peruse the fine print closely, so you don't end up paying good gil for a scrap of parchment useless for the particular item you wish to store.<Prompt>
Not that we moogles would object to that sort of donation, kupo.<Prompt>
Choose the item you wish to entrust, then trade it to me along with a single storage slip. I will take the item and return the slip to you, marked with an invisible seal.<Prompt>
Invisible to you, at least. It's plain as day to us moogles, so don't even think of trying to pull one over on us, kupo.<Prompt>
When it comes time to retrieve your item, just trade to me a single storage slip--any slip--once again.<Prompt>
I will present you with a list of all the items currently in my care, and you may choose the one you wish to withdraw. Simple as that, kupo!<Prompt>
What's more, no additional transaction fees will be incurred! Pretty generous of us for a change, no.<Prompt>
Now I bet you're wondering what the catch is, kupo. So as not to disappoint you, there are a few!<Prompt>
For one, any signed items will lose their signatures if you store them with me.<Prompt>
Why, you say. Hey, even we moogles aren't perfect! It's better for both of us if you keep your most precious possessions close at hand, kupo.<Prompt>
Now listen up, because there's another catch, and it's a doozy.<Prompt>

If you lose your storage slip, I won't be able to return your item. Ever. No ifs, ands, or buts! No  I'm sorry, Mister Porter Moogle, it'll never happen again!  Rules are rules, kupo, and someone has to keep them.<Prompt>
Last, but not least, I can't accept equipment bearing Magian trial insignia.<Prompt>
If you have such an item that you're simply dying to entrust to me, you'll have to abandon your trial first, kupo.<Prompt>
And that's all there is to it. This humble moogle can hardly wait to serve you!<Prompt>

'Tis good to see your face, <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 8)>. We have been waiting for a missive from our former captain, Excenmille. Have you heard aught.<Prompt>
I see. So then we are both equally in the dark. I can only hope that naught has befallen him in Rhazowa.<Prompt>
It would be wholly unlike him to be bested with ease.<Prompt>
You are right, of course. Ever true the old phrase,  No news is good news. <Prompt>
Truth be told, my worries lie with Captain Rahal.<Prompt>
<Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 8)>, perchance you have stumbled upon him. As captain of the Swiftwing Griffins, his days are long and his nights yet longer.<Prompt>
He leads new recruits onto the field of battle nearly each day, aiming to inspire them by vanquishing what remains of the Orcs.<Prompt>
Regardless of the glory, honor, and fame he earns for himself, he aspires to become more.<Prompt>
We beg him to repose, to let others handle this task, yet he refuses to listen to us. You, on the other hand...<Prompt>
It comes as no surprise that Rahal would take nary a moment to rest.<Prompt>
Excenmille!
.Is that truly you!
.Bistillot, Rholont. And <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 8)>. I trust the three of you fare well and continue to grow each day.<Prompt>
And you, too, have shot up in height-- But what on Vana'diel has brought you back.<Prompt>
The struggle against the Orcs is ceaseless, but our efforts have finally borne fruit. We succeeded in toppling one of their main fortresses.<Prompt>
I was tasked with delivering a report to His Majesty, as well as cobbling together a regiment of fresh reinforcements.<Prompt>

Jayramus remains ever the bother, so freeing myself from his shackles was somewhat of a boon. I would, however, be weaving an untruth were I to say that my trek across the Uleguerand Range was so simple.<Prompt>
But seeing you all has lightened my heart and given wings to my spirit.<Prompt>
Your words are far too kind!<Prompt>
And news of your victory pleases us further still. Striking at the heart of the enemy and drawing blood bodes well for us--I only hope that it buys us some measure of respite.<Prompt>
We left men of the highest caliber to secure the front, but I am afraid we cannot rest on our laurels. A counterattack is surely on the horizon.<Prompt>
But enough tales of victory. You say that Rahal is causing you some consternation.<Prompt>
Far be it from him to listen to me, or to any of our elders, but I realize now that we cannot be tethered to what we once were.<Prompt>
Would you not agree, <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 8)>.<Prompt>
We become strong to protect what we hold dear, yet with each passing moment our responsibilities grow in number. This is a sign of maturity.<Prompt>
Excenmille!
.Wha--!
.What is the meaning of this!.<Prompt>
Tell me, <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 8)>!<Prompt>
I am your alter ego, Excenmille. Something similar to you, but not wholly the same, representing who you are before you are fully an adult.<Prompt>
But how is such a thing--!.<Prompt>
I-is this some form of new magic. Never in my few years have I heard of such...<Prompt>
Wait! This presents an opportunity most golden.<Prompt>
Could Excenmille's...alter ego...talk some sense into Rahal.<Prompt>
Rholont, your perspicacity when facing the unknown has taken me by pleasant surprise.<Prompt>
Excenmille, your approval means more than I could possibly express!<Prompt>
Men, word has reached me that Excenmille...<Prompt>
...has...<Prompt>
B-by the Goddess, there are two of them!<Prompt>
My eyes...deceive me not. I had wondered if I had been beset by vertigo.<Prompt>
Perhaps...perhaps I should take a rest.<Prompt>
Captain!
.Rahal!
.This has certainly taken a turn for the unexpected...yet somehow, all is well in the end
